title: Thompson’s Plum-Pudding Atomic Model: The Making of a Scientific Myth’

A129–33. A traditional plum pudding actually consists of a uniform distribution of raisins baked in a suet pudding. As the raisins are stationary, they don’t really serve as a helpful metaphor for the electrons in Thomson’s model, which are supposed to be continually moving
